text: Hi <@U01RG97SUNL>! We did several review rounds with Ana (the designer of what you linked) but we never totally finished the designs. The main problem with those is the blue accent color used as background, a resource we don’t want to use in a UI supposed to be lighter. I don’t have any quick suggestion at the moment: coming up with a proper design integrated with the design system will require time. If you find a designer that can do that this week it’d be great. Otherwise I don’t have the time this week, so as I mentioned on my earlier comment I might be able to help next week and propose designs for Claro.

elements.text: Hi

! We did several review rounds with Ana (the designer of what you linked) but we never totally finished the designs. The main problem with those is the blue accent color used as background, a resource we don’t want to use in a UI supposed to be lighter. I don’t have any quick suggestion at the moment: coming up with a proper design integrated with the design system will require time. If you find a designer that can do that this week it’d be great. Otherwise I don’t have the time this week, so as I mentioned on my earlier comment I might be able to help next week and propose designs for Claro.

text:
Ok <@U1ET7192M>
Will check if there’s any designer or will wait for your feedback until then.

elements.text: Ok

text: Either way, as I mentioned an initial commit could be prepared without the current Claro styles so it doesn’t block the whole initiative and the rest of the feedback given (like the accessibility one by Andrew).

text:
Hi <@U1ET7192M> <@U06NAEYSF>
Removed the claro styling. Please check the screenshots.
Just want to mention one thing regarding dates in the standard feeds. As it is taking default styling we will face a11y issues. Do we need to add some different colour to it?

text: This needs to be fixed, yes. But instead of changing the link color I’d remove the white background from the standard announcement.

elements.text: This needs to be fixed, yes. But instead of changing the link color I’d remove the white background from the standard announcement.

text: By adding the white you’re actually highlighting them in this dark region, so I would rely just on the heading & text size to add importance to the top ones.

elements.text: By adding the white you’re actually highlighting them in this dark region, so I would rely just on the heading & text size to add importance to the top ones.

text: Also, be aware of the cross being printed over the title :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Also, be aware of the cross being printed over the title

text:
Yeah, because of the default styling these things are happening.
Had to add white background for standard feeds to differentiate it from featured ones. Will change it to some different color from the default’s color palette.

elements.text:
Yeah, because of the default styling these things are happening.
Had to add white background for standard feeds to differentiate it from featured ones. Will change it to some different color from the default’s color palette.

text: I wouldn’t add any background color at all. Just with bigger typography on the featured ones should be enough. The moment you’re adding colors you’re making big visual changes. If any, the featured ones should be the ones with lighter color actually. In a dark background the light background is highlighting things.

elements.text: I wouldn’t add any background color at all. Just with bigger typography on the featured ones should be enough. The moment you’re adding colors you’re making big visual changes. If any, the featured ones should be the ones with lighter color actually. In a dark background the light background is highlighting things.
